CITY COUNCIL
SPECIAL MEETING
AUGUST 3, 2020
2:00 PM
SULLIVAN CHAMBER

~FINAL ACTIONS~
MEETING

Monday, August 3, 2020

TIME

2:00 PM

PRESIDING OFFICER

Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui


PAGE 1

Aug 3, 2020

THE CITY COUNCIL WILL MEET IN A SPECIAL SESSION TO VOTE
ON RELOCATION OF POLLING LOCATIONS
I. CALL TO ORDER
Attendee Name
Dennis J. Carlone
Patricia Nolan
Jivan Sobrinho-Wheeler
Alanna Mallon
Marc C. McGovern
Sumbul Siddiqui
E. Denise Simmons
Timothy J. Toomey
Quinton Zondervan



Arrived

2:14 PM

Aug 3, 2020

II. CITY MANAGER'S AGENDA
1. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to a report received
from the Board of Election Commissioners requesting the City Council vote to temporarily relocate
polling sites in response to COVID-19.
CMA 2020 #179
RESULT:
REPORT RECEIVED AND RELOCATION APPROVED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor
McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey, Councillor
Zondervan

ABSENT:

Councillor Carlone


PAGE 3

Aug 3, 2020

III. POLICY ORDER AND RESOLUTION LIST
1. That the city manager be and hereby is requested to look into suspending street cleaning on
September 1, 2020 and November 3, 2020; that he work with the Elections Commission to order 8
additional drop boxes and to inquire whether CHA will have additional locations for drop boxes.
CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR TOOMEY
IN COUNCIL AUGUST 3, 2020
POR 2020 #184
Councillor Simmons
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR TOOMEY
Next: 9/14/2020 5:30 PM

PAGE 4

Aug 3, 2020

2.1

August 3, 2020
To the Honorable, the City Council:
Please find attached for your consideration, a report received from the Board of Election Commissioners
relative to a request for the City Council to vote to temporarily relocate polling sites in response to
COVID-19.
Very truly yours,

Louis A. DePasquale
City Manager
LAD/mec
Attachment(s)

Packet Pg. 54

3.1

City of Cambridge
O-1
IN CITY COUNCIL
August 3, 2020
COUNCILLOR SIMMONS
ORDERED:

That the city manager be and hereby is requested to look into suspending street
cleaning on September 1, 2020 and November 3, 2020; that he work with the Elections
Commission to order 8 additional drop boxes and to inquire whether CHA will have
additional locations for drop boxes

Packet Pg. 55
